coverage: Haggai (520 BCE) delivers four dated oracles that reignite the Second Temple project: rebuke for misplaced priorities, assurance of divine presence, priestly clarification of holiness versus defilement, and a climactic royal promise to Zerubbabel amid a cosmic shaking that channels the nations’ treasure to God’s house. The book welds post-exilic praxis to covenant memory and future hope, coordinating with Ezra 5–6 and Zechariah 1–8 and echoed in Hebrews 12.
id_scheme: Cross-book stable by (type+primary-slug) + deterministic hash; alias reuse for shared entities.

entries: From this day I bless you
Hill country (go up and bring wood)
Presence theology: I am with you

entries.name: Haggai
entries.blurb: Post-exilic prophet whose oracles in 520 BCE catalyze the Temple rebuild through rebuke, encouragement, legal clarification, and royal promise.

entries.name: Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel
entries.blurb: Governor of Yehud; representative of the Davidic line. Promised as YHWH’s ‘signet ring,’ signaling covenant fidelity and future hope.

entries.name: Joshua (Jeshua) son of Jehozadak
entries.blurb: High priest partnering with Zerubbabel. Central to ritual purity and the legitimation of the rebuilt Temple.

entries.name: Darius I (Persian king)
entries.blurb: Persian ruler whose regnal year dates Haggai’s messages. His administration frames Yehud’s provincial realities.

entries.name: Priests
entries.blurb: Consulted on holiness/defilement transfer; their ruling diagnoses the people’s impurity pre-repentance.

entries.name: Elders/Heads of fathers’ houses
entries.blurb: Local leaders coordinating work and consent; continuity with Ezra’s narrative.

entries.name: Remnant of the people
entries.blurb: Post-exilic body that obeys the word, fears the LORD, and resumes the work when their spirits are stirred.

entries.name: Opponents (context from Ezra)
entries.blurb: Regional opposition that delayed the rebuild until prophetic intervention reignited authorization.

entries.name: Scribes/Recorders
entries.blurb: Officials responsible for dating/oracle documentation; ensure durable memory of commands and promises.

entries.name: Judah
entries.blurb: The covenant community reconstituted in Yehud, summoned to prioritize the LORD’s house.

entries.name: Jerusalem
entries.blurb: City center where the house lies desolate until the community obeys the word to build.

entries.name: Israel
entries.blurb: Broader covenant identity evoked by temple theology and restoration hopes.

entries.name: Nations
entries.blurb: Peoples shaken so that treasure/glory flows toward God’s house; also scope of divine sovereignty.

entries.name: Householders with paneled houses
entries.blurb: Residents investing in private comfort while the Temple remains in ruins—focus of the initial rebuke.

entries.name: Priestly cohort
entries.blurb: Priests tasked with halakhic discernment; their answers structure the defilement diagnosis.

entries.name: Workforce with stirred spirit
entries.blurb: Collective energized by divine presence to rebuild the house.

entries.name: Heavens
entries.blurb: Part of the created order enlisted in covenant discipline (withholding dew).

entries.name: Earth
entries.blurb: Yield curtailed under covenant discipline; later blessed ‘from this day.’

entries.name: Sea
entries.blurb: Included in the shaking imagery signaling cosmic scope.

entries.name: Dry land
entries.blurb: Complements the sea in total-creation shaking.

entries.name: YHWH (the LORD)
entries.blurb: Speaker of rebuke and comfort, owner of silver and gold, present with his people, and sovereign over nations and cosmos.

entries.name: Spirit of the LORD
entries.blurb: Stirs Zerubbabel, Joshua, and the remnant to obey and work—personal presence empowering communal renewal.

entries.name: Superscription & date frame
entries.blurb: Four time-stamped oracles in Darius’s second year (520 BCE) providing a precise historical scaffold.

entries.name: Oracle #1: Consider your ways
entries.blurb: Reproof for neglecting the house; call to bring wood and build so God may take pleasure and be glorified.

entries.name: Withheld dew & drought
entries.blurb: Covenant discipline expressed through environmental shortage across grain, wine, oil, and labor returns.

entries.name: Oracle #2: I am with you
entries.blurb: Assurance of presence catalyzing obedience; spirits stirred in leaders and people.

entries.name: Small beginnings → greater glory
entries.blurb: The present house, though modest, will surpass the former in glory; peace promised in this place.

entries.name: Oracle #3: Holiness vs. defilement (priestly Q&A)
entries.blurb: Two halakhic hypotheticals reveal that defilement transfers readily but holiness does not; the people’s work had been unclean.

entries.name: Oracle #4: Zerubbabel the signet
entries.blurb: On the day of shaking, Zerubbabel is chosen as a signet ring—symbol of authority and covenant fidelity.

entries.name: Shaking of the nations
entries.blurb: Heaven and earth, sea and dry land convulse; thrones and chariots are overthrown.

entries.name: From this day I bless you
entries.blurb: Turning point marked on the calendar: despite prior crop failure, blessing begins from the foundation day.

entries.name: Desire/Treasures of all nations
entries.note: Translation debated; this corpus emphasizes treasure/tribute influx while noting traditional Christological reading in some traditions.
entries.blurb: The wealth/glory of nations comes to fill God’s house; mission-through-Temple motif.

entries.name: Signet ring (royal investiture)
entries.blurb: Seal of royal authority; in Haggai, a pledge to the Davidic line embodied in Zerubbabel.

entries.name: Covenant from Egypt → present work
entries.blurb: The same covenant and Spirit from the Exodus undergird courage and work in the present.

entries.name: Temple (Second Temple)
entries.blurb: Central project of Haggai; locus of divine pleasure, glory, and peace.

entries.name: Foundation stone
entries.blurb: Laid as the hinge of blessing; tangible sign of work resumed.

entries.name: Altar
entries.blurb: Sacrificial center implying need for purity; background to holiness/defilement diagnosis.

entries.name: Paneled houses
entries.blurb: Symbol of misaligned priorities—lavished attention on private dwellings while the house lies waste.

entries.name: Timber
entries.blurb: Wood to be brought from the hills for rebuilding.

entries.name: Stone
entries.blurb: Construction material for the house; image of permanence.

entries.name: Hill country (go up and bring wood)
entries.blurb: Source landscape for materials; obedience has logistical expression.

entries.name: Dew
entries.blurb: Withheld as part of covenant discipline, reversing agrarian blessing.

entries.name: Drought
entries.blurb: Summoned against land, grain, wine, oil, men, cattle, and labor.

entries.name: Grain
entries.blurb: One of the triad of staples diminished under discipline.

entries.name: Wine
entries.blurb: Staple produce; also used in priestly hypotheticals.

entries.name: Oil
entries.blurb: Olive oil scarcity marks economic distress pre-blessing.

entries.name: Work of your hands
entries.blurb: Comprehensive scope of defilement prior to repentance; later blessed.

entries.name: Holy meat
entries.blurb: Consecrated flesh used as a test case for holiness transfer.

entries.name: Fold of a robe
entries.blurb: Carrier in the first hypothetical—does holiness transfer by contact? (Answer: no).

entries.name: Unclean corpse
entries.blurb: Defilement source in the second hypothetical—uncleanness does transfer by contact.

entries.name: Skirt/garment (conduit)
entries.blurb: Instrument in holiness test; highlights non-transfer of holiness.

entries.name: Silver is Mine
entries.blurb: Affirms divine ownership of resources mobilized for the house.

entries.name: Gold is Mine
entries.blurb: Parallel to silver; undercuts scarcity anxiety.

entries.name: Zion
entries.blurb: Theological locus of peace associated with the house.

entries.name: Jerusalem
entries.blurb: Urban center of the rebuild and communal obedience.

entries.name: Province of Yehud
entries.blurb: Persian province in which Judah/Jerusalem function post-exile.

entries.name: Sixth month
entries.blurb: Timestamp of Oracle #1 in Darius’s second year.

entries.name: Seventh month
entries.blurb: Timestamp of Oracle #2; encouragement during Sukkot season context.

entries.name: Ninth month
entries.blurb: Timestamp for Oracles #3–#4; hinge for ‘from this day’ blessing.

entries.name: Twenty-fourth day
entries.blurb: Repeated day-mark that punctuates restart of work and covenant blessing.

entries.name: Measuring line
entries.blurb: Associated with rebuilding/planning; intertextual link to Zechariah’s visions.

entries.name: Construction tools
entries.blurb: Implied implements (hammers, chisels, plumb lines) for rebuilding the house.

entries.name: Foundation measurement
entries.blurb: Technical act marking the blessing hinge; ensures tangible progress.

entries.name: Heavens/Earth/Sea/Dry land (cosmic set)
entries.blurb: The entire created order addressed in the shaking—signals theophanic sovereignty.

entries.name: Presence theology: I am with you
entries.blurb: Divine presence as the primary motivator and comfort for obedience.

entries.name: Spirit stirs the people
entries.blurb: Personal agency of the Spirit energizes leadership and laity.

entries.name: Holiness & defilement transfer logic
entries.blurb: Hermeneutic key: impurity spreads; holiness requires consecration and obedience.

entries.name: Greater glory of this house
entries.blurb: Promise that presence and peace confer a surpassing glory on the second house.

entries.name: Shaking once more (Heb 12:26–27)
entries.blurb: New Testament reads Haggai’s shaking as eschatological removal of the shakable to reveal the unshakable kingdom.

entries.name: Zerubbabel and the Davidic hope
entries.blurb: Signet promise sustains expectation of Davidic restoration without immediate enthronement.

entries.name: Temple as mission center
entries.blurb: Nations’ treasures flow to the house; peace radiates from God’s presence in Zion.

entries.name: Ezra 5–6 coordination
entries.blurb: Imperial verification and decrees align with prophetic impetus to complete the Temple.

entries.name: Zechariah 1–8 coordination
entries.blurb: Parallel prophetic window with shared leaders, temple vision, and eschatological encouragement.
